item.title: [JDK-8308592] Framework for CA interoperability testing
item.description:
Few of the CA interop test certificates used in jdk_security_infra test group are expired. Some of them have the new test certificates issued from CA. These test artifacts are usually short lived and requires frequent update to interoperability tests.

We should create a different framework for interoperability testing to avoid these frequent updates. One solution is to connect to test portals using https with certpath validation.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[jdk8u-fix-request] Approval Request from Andrew Hughes
This change reworks the certificate tests to use test portals rather than having to maintain copies of the certificates in the OpenJDK repository and so should reduce the maintenance cost of these tests going forward. The fix has already been backported to the other LTS JDKs (11u, 17u, 21u). The backport required manually removing some tests which were not in their latest versions, a couple of dependent backports to provide us with SkippedException and a passing Actalis test, and 8u-specific modifications (change of cacerts location and type, enable jdk.tls.client.enableStatusRequestExtension). All tests passed successfully.
